name: 林祐正
objective:
This course will provide students with the computational fundamental skills necessary to plan and schedule the entire construction process and familiarize them with computer project management software packages. Students will learn to mix and match available resources in the most efficient combinations to complete projects on time and within budget. Furthermore,
the student may utilize computational programming to efficiently plan and execute municipal infrastructure programs and support contractors’ decisions on high risk and constrained projects.
schedule:
1. Computer-based Project Management in Construction
2. The application of Construction Computer-based Project Management
3. Information Management Technology
4. The application of Visual Basic Application in Excel
5. Construction Management System - Introduction (P6 and Project 2003)
6. Web-based Construction Management System 
7. The application of Database in Construction Management
8. The application of BIM in Construction Management
9. Construction Simulation and automation 
10. Special Topics in Construction Management Information
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance and class participation (10%)
2. Homework (20%)
3. Mid project presentation (10%) and Mid project report (20%)
4. Final project presentation (10%) and final project report (30%)
